are endemic to sandy soils of coastal habitats in southern Santa
Cruz and northern Monterey Counties. The inner rim of Monterey Bay is
characterized by broad, sandy beaches backed by an extensive dune
formation. Just inland from the immediate coast, maritime chaparral occupies areas with well-drained soils. Coastal dune and coastal scrub
communities exist along the inner rim of Monterey Bay, but portions were
affected by habitat modification or destruction.
